text:
Yup that fixed it. Thanks! Here's MDN:

```form
The <form> element to associate the <select> with (its form owner). The value of this attribute must be the id of a <form> in the same document. (If this attribute is not set, the <select> is associated with its ancestor <form> element, if any.)

This attribute lets you associate <select> elements to <form>s anywhere in the document, not just inside a <form>. It can also override an ancestor <form> element.```

text: sorry, not sure if the idea with the "don't update the main state" was clear. What I mean is that you can just filter before the .map in the representational component for the products. I.e. you could have something like a "ProductList" component, that get's two props => the *whole* list + a set of filters. And then based on those filters determines what it should render in a .filter().map(toSingleComponent) chain in the return! :)

elements.text: sorry, not sure if the idea with the "don't update the main state" was clear. What I mean is that you can just filter before the .map in the representational component for the products. I.e. you could have something like a "ProductList" component, that get's two props => the
whole
list + a set of filters. And then based on those filters determines what it should render in a .filter().map(toSingleComponent) chain in the return! :)
I'm confused if state declared in a parent needs to be passed as a prop to children or if it is simply available to those children. Needs to be passed right?

text: yep. needs to be passed.

elements.text: yep. needs to be passed.

text:
> Why do I don´t want change the main state (back to the original jsonData)?
> On the products table I´m filtering already by search input, somehow it feels weird to squeeze another filter in there...
you are right, it's not necessary.

If you are already filtering in the products table, then it's completely fine!

I am just saying that there are two ways/places where you could be filtering. either when passing down the products props to the Products table *or* in the Products table component itself.
